summary: Build a single-page 'Be My Valentine' interactive web page with multiple sections, animations (falling hearts, glitter, roses, kisses, teddy), playful Yes/No buttons, loading screen, and background music, using HTML/CSS/JS and local media assets.
architectural_notes: Single HTML file with inline CSS and JS to control page navigation (show/hide sections).
Uses timed DOM element spawning via setInterval for effects (hearts, glitter sparkles, roses, kisses, teddy).
Requires local static assets: images (photo1.jpg, photo2.jpg, photo3.jpg, yourphoto.jpg) and audio (papa_eppadi_vandhaayo.mp3/music.mp3).
Includes full-screen loading overlay that hides after a timeout.
Plays looping background music via <audio> element and JS source assignment.

existing_features.title: Implement a single-page React (TypeScript) experience that reproduces the provided HTML concept as 5 sequential sections ("pages") with a Next button to navigate forward (Page 1 → Page 5) and a smooth fade-in transition when the active page changes.

Convert all user-facing text to English and ensure no non-English paragraph text is shown in the UI; preserve the romantic tone and overall meaning of Page 5 content while rewriting it fully in English.

Recreate the ambient animations from the provided HTML using React-safe DOM management (create/remove elements cleanly to avoid memory leaks): falling hearts, glitter sparkles, floating roses, floating kiss bubbles, and a bouncing teddy in the bottom-right corner.
Implement the playful 'No' button behavior on Page 5: clicking 'No' moves the button to a random position within the viewport so it is difficult to click repeatedly.
Replace the Page 5 'Yes' button JavaScript alert with an in-app UI confirmation state (e.g., modal/dialog or inline success message) that celebrates the 'Yes' response.
Add a loading screen overlay that displays a heart and an English 'Loading…' message on initial load, then automatically disappears after ~2 seconds.

Support background music playback via a bundled local audio asset and provide basic user controls (play/pause and mute/unmute). If autoplay is blocked by the browser, the UI must prompt the user to start playback.
Support the four images referenced in the provided HTML (photo1.jpg, photo2.jpg, photo3.jpg, yourphoto.jpg) as static assets and render them on their respective pages with rounded corners.
Make the page mobile-friendly: ensure content fits smaller screens, maintain comfortable padding, and keep animations from blocking scrolling/taps (animations must not intercept pointer events).

Apply a coherent Valentine-themed visual design using Tailwind (avoid a blue/purple primary palette): soft romantic background, consistent typography scale, card-like page container, and button styles consistent across all pages.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create 'Be My Valentine' interactive multi-page/section romantic web page (HTML/CSS/JS) with animations, images, and background music
